Package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup

Interface NetworkConfiguration

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
BarabasiAlbertConfiguration, ErdosReyniConfiguration, WattsStrogatzConfiguration
public interface NetworkConfiguration extends Serializable
Abstract configuration for network generation used during model setup.

Concrete implementations provide parameters for specific graph generation algorithms (for example Erdos‑Reyni, Watts‑Strogatz and Barabasi‑Albert). The configuration objects are consumed by the model builder during the setupOutbreak stage to create the social network used by the simulation.

Extension guidance: to add a new network type implement a new configuration class and add it to the Jackson polymorphic mapping above (or register it with your object mapper). Keep generation logic in the configuration's generateGraph(org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge>) method so the builder can remain generic.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Method Details

    • generateGraph

      void generateGraph(org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<Person,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge> socialNetwork)
      Generate a social network graph according to the concrete configuration parameters.

      Builders pass an empty SimpleGraph and expect the method to populate it with nodes and edges. Implementations should add nodes and edges deterministically from the configuration values so results can be reproduced when the same seed is used.

      Parameters:
      socialNetwork - mutable graph to populate with nodes and edges

    • getNetworkDegree

      Integer getNetworkDegree()
      Model parameter: target average degree for the generated network.
      Returns:
      the average number of social network contacts

    • getNetworkSize

      Integer getNetworkSize()
      Model parameter: number of agents to generate in the network.
      Returns:
      the number of agents in the model
